## Chord: Major 7th in F# (Shape: D)

### Brief Presentation:
The major 7th chord in the key of F# (Shape: D) consists of the notes F#, A#, C#, and E#. This chord creates a rich, dreamy sound due to the extended major 7th interval, giving it a lush and sophisticated quality in various musical contexts.

### Notes and Intervals:
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)
- E# (Major 7th)

### Musical Flavor and Genre:
The major 7th chord in F# (Shape: D) adds a touch of elegance and emotion to music. It is commonly used in jazz, R&B, and pop genres to create a sense of warmth and sophistication. This chord can evoke feelings of nostalgia, romance, or contemplation, depending on how it is harmonized and played.
